subject: Art
title: Typographic Details
description: Quotes, dashes, and special characters that separate amateurs from pros.

hook.text: "Smart quotes" vs "dumb quotes." Em dashes â€” vs hyphens -. Ellipsis â€¦ vs three dots... These tiny details are the difference between amateur and professional typography. They're invisible when correct and screaming when wrong.

buildup.text: Key details: curly/smart quotes (not straight quotes), em dash for breaks, en dash for ranges, proper ellipsis character, non-breaking spaces before units, and correct apostrophes. These micro-details define professional type.

discovery.text: Special characters: fi, fl ligatures (where f and i/l connect), old-style figures (1234 with ascenders/descenders for body text), and small caps (properly designed, not just shrunken capitals).

twist.text: These details are the typographic equivalent of a well-pressed suit vs a wrinkled one. The content is the same, but the impression is completely different. Attention to typographic detail signals professionalism.

climax.text: Open any published book and examine the quotes, dashes, and ligatures. Then open a casual blog post. The difference in typographic care is immediately visible. Professional typography sweats these details.

punchline.text: God is in the details. Typography's details are quotes, dashes, and ligatures.

quiz.question: What is the difference between an em dash (â€”) and a hyphen (-)?
options: An em dash is longer, used for breaks in thought; a hyphen is short, used to join compound words
